    <author>
        <name>Bradley Allsop</name>

    </author>
    <content type="html" xml:lang="en-US" xml:base="http://huffingtonpost.co.uk/">
		        There seems to be an arrogance in the higher education sector too when it comes to how domestic and foreign students are treated- we seem to be under the impression that because we have such world-renowned institutions of learning that students will keep coming no matter how we treat them. Maybe they will, but perhaps they shouldn't - perhaps Britain doesn't deserve them.

    <title>Crispin Blunt:  In the Panic to Prevent Irregular Migration and Save Schengen, The EU Is Losing Sight of the Bigger Picture in Its Relations With Turkey</title>
            <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/crispin-blunt/turkey-eu-immigration_b_9495060.html" />
        <id>http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/crispin-blunt/turkey-eu-immigration_b_9495060.html</id>
    
    <published>2016-03-17T19:00:00Z</published>
    <updated>2016-03-18T06:58:38Z</updated>
    
    <author>
        <name>Crispin Blunt</name>
        <uri>http://huffingtonpost.co.uk/crispin-blunt/</uri>
    </author>
    <content type="html" xml:lang="en-US" xml:base="http://huffingtonpost.co.uk/">
		        Turkey has been propelled into a tailspin and it is increasingly difficult to see how it can recover. Ordinary Turkish citizens face economic, security, and political challenges akin to those faced by some of their Arab neighbours. This stems from their own Government's failed and failing authoritarian policies. Furthermore, Erdogan hangs over Turkey the prospect of a constitutional referendum to move towards a more presidential system. Given the management of the last election, full dictatorship is now alarmingly close.
        	    <p>Read more: <a href="/tag/turkey">Turkey</a>, <a href="/tag/eu-immigration">EU Immigration</a>, <a href="/tag/uk-immigration">UK Immigration</a>, <a href="/tag/uk-conservative-party">UK Conservative Party</a>, <a href="/tag/foreign-affairs-select-committee">Foreign Affairs Select Committee</a>, <a href="/tag/erdogan">Erdogan</a>, <a href="/tag/crispin-blunt">Crispin Blunt</a>,  <a href="/uk-politics">UK Politics News</a></p>

	    </content>

            </entry> <entry>
    <title>Kezia Dugdale:  Order an Inquiry Today, Prime Minister</title>
            <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/kezia-dugdale/refugee-scotland-kezia-dugdale_b_9494632.html" />
        <id>http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/kezia-dugdale/refugee-scotland-kezia-dugdale_b_9494632.html</id>
    
    <published>2016-03-18T09:25:52Z</published>
    <updated>2016-03-18T05:29:21Z</updated>
    
    <author>
        <name>Kezia Dugdale</name>
        <uri>http://huffingtonpost.co.uk/kezia-dugdale/</uri>
    </author>
    <content type="html" xml:lang="en-US" xml:base="http://huffingtonpost.co.uk/">
		        The Tory government pays these companies millions of pounds to provide accommodation to recently arrived refugees. This is public money and the companies receiving it must be held to account for the way they treat people in need in our name.  If they do not do that, then they should not retain these lucrative contracts. These are extremely serious allegations and the Prime Minister should stop prevaricating- he should order an independent investigation today.
        	    <p>Read more: <a href="/tag/uk-politics">UK Politics</a>, <a href="/tag/uk-labour-party">UK Labour Party</a>, <a href="/tag/scottish-labour">Scottish Labour</a>, <a href="/tag/kezia-dugdale">Kezia Dugdale</a>, <a href="/tag/david-cameron">David Cameron</a>, <a href="/tag/immigration">Immigration</a>, <a href="/tag/home-office">Home Office</a>, <a href="/tag/scottish-elections">Scottish Elections</a>, <a href="/tag/scottish-politics">Scottish Politics</a>, <a href="/tag/refugees">Refugees</a>, <a href="/tag/refugee-crisis">Refugee Crisis</a>,  <a href="/uk-politics">UK Politics News</a></p>

	    </content>

            </entry> <entry>
    <title>Caroline Lucas:  The Immigration Bill Shows How Parliament Needs to Up Its Scrutiny Game</title>

    <title>Jude Kirton-Darling:  The Referendum Is Not About Immigration: Here's Why</title>
            <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/jude-kirtondarling/eu-referendum-immigration_b_9324646.html" />
        <id>http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/jude-kirtondarling/eu-referendum-immigration_b_9324646.html</id>
    
    <published>2016-02-26T19:00:00Z</published>
    <updated>2016-02-26T12:44:17Z</updated>
    
    <author>
        <name>Jude Kirton-Darling</name>
        <uri>http://huffingtonpost.co.uk/jude-kirtondarling/</uri>
    </author>
    <content type="html" xml:lang="en-US" xml:base="http://huffingtonpost.co.uk/">
		        The EU referendum is a massive decision which we all have to make and it affects jobs, investment, our rights and safety. Some people want to make the referendum about immigration but the evidence suggests a leave vote would give us no increased control over our own borders. In fact, leaving the EU could actually cause migration to rise.

	    </content>

    <title>Ian Middleton:  We Shouldn't Let the Immigration Debate Decide Our Place in Europe</title>
            <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/ian-middleton/eu-referendum-immigration_b_9322718.html" />
        <id>http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/ian-middleton/eu-referendum-immigration_b_9322718.html</id>
    
    <published>2016-02-25T21:15:05Z</published>
    <updated>2016-02-26T05:24:57Z</updated>
    
    <author>
        <name>Ian Middleton</name>
        <uri>http://huffingtonpost.co.uk/ian-middleton/</uri>
    </author>
    <content type="html" xml:lang="en-US" xml:base="http://huffingtonpost.co.uk/">
		        As Britain shrivels into, at best, a tawdry tax haven in perpetual serfdom to a rich elite, we'll come to the sad realisation that we've been sold a Jerusalem built on false promises and false flags.  I wonder if border controls and apocryphal straight bananas will seem quite so important then.

	    </content>

    <title>Steve Ballinger:  Why It's Time for an Office for Citizenship and Integration in London</title>
            <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/steve-ballinger/london-citizenship-integration_b_9314340.html" />
        <id>http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/steve-ballinger/london-citizenship-integration_b_9314340.html</id>
    
    <published>2016-02-25T06:10:18Z</published>
    <updated>2016-02-26T05:16:39Z</updated>
    
    <author>
        <name>Steve Ballinger</name>
        <uri>http://huffingtonpost.co.uk/steve-ballinger/</uri>
    </author>
    <content type="html" xml:lang="en-US" xml:base="http://huffingtonpost.co.uk/">
		        London is already an integration success story. Look at other capitals and you'll see that we all rub along better than most. But we can't just assume it will work out by itself. With a dynamic individual driving forward a proactive plan, London could do so much more, becoming a beacon for more successful integration across the whole of Britain and helping to develop a stronger, shared sense of what integration means and how it can work in practice.
        	    <p>Read more: <a href="/tag/london">London</a>, <a href="/tag/citizenship">Citizenship</a>, <a href="/tag/integration">Integration</a>, <a href="/tag/immigration">Immigration</a>,  <a href="/uk-politics">UK Politics News</a></p>

	    </content>
